channel.title: can black mesa bring life to enemy soilders
channel.description: one of my biggest disapointments with Half-Life 2 was the fact that the combine were so unhuman compare to the HECU of the first one. for example when you threw a grenade they didnt run for their life they simply joged slowly away. did they sneakly place grenades no did they flush you out with grenades and poping round corners no they did not when you shot them did they limp of feel pain no. will the soilders in black mesa be even more realistic or on par with the HECU? did anyone else notice this? please dont lock I AM being serious

item.title: can black mesa bring life to enemy soilders
item.description:
got a wee cheek on you. but seriously, in that context, it is ok to deny its other meaning, if you follow, bud.

Read full topic
item.source: can black mesa bring life to enemy soilders

item.title: can black mesa bring life to enemy soilders
item.dc:creator: Spycrabz
item.description:
213:

soilder is a common typo, not a misspelling. even if someone were a phonetic speller, they’d realize soilder sounds nothing like soldier.

basically you’re angry/annoyed at someone who doesn’t have very dexterous finger, failed to double check his posts, or simply didn’t see the typo.

just putting things into perspective…

:what:

Read full topic

item.description:
Taking the thread’s title literally, Medics carry defibrillators to shock marines back into life. :awesome:

item.source: can black mesa bring life to enemy soilders

item.title: can black mesa bring life to enemy soilders
item.description:
geekofalltrades:

Posting on page 7 to point out that the thread title says “soilders.” Honest to fucking god, people, the word “soldier” is not that hard to spell. It isn’t “soilder.” It isn’t “solider.” It’s “soldier.”

Thank you for indulging my pet peeve.

soilder is a common typo, not a misspelling. even if someone were a phonetic speller, they’d realize soilder sounds nothing like soldier.

basically you’re angry/annoyed at someone who doesn’t have very dexterous finger, failed to double check his posts, or simply didn’t see the typo.

just putting things into perspective…

Read full topic
item.source: can black mesa bring life to enemy soilders

item.title: can black mesa bring life to enemy soilders
item.dc:creator: LimitBreak
item.description:
geekofalltrades:

Posting on page 7 to point out that the thread title says “soilders.” Honest to fucking god, people, the word “soldier” is not that hard to spell. It isn’t “soilder.” It isn’t “solider.” It’s “soldier.”

Thank you for indulging my pet peeve.

Hopefully, everyone on the Internet has the time and effort to actually spell out their words. Unfortunately, it doesn’t always work that way. Certain people don’t have the capability of being on the Internet. It’s almost as if they were drunk or out of their minds.

item.title: can black mesa bring life to enemy soilders
item.dc:creator: UrBY
item.description:
DansonDelta40:

I liked how the mercenaries in Far Cry 2 had this loop of in-combat-conversation that really added to the atmosphere of the game.

Not sure whether something similar would also benefit Black Mesa, though.

Shame none of FC2’s voice actors could act for shit.
